definition: the national flag of the United States of America
opposite_reasoning: Flag is a human-made symbolic artifact with national/cultural significance. NaturalObject provides the clearest semantic opposition: artificial vs. natural, manufactured vs. occurring, symbolic/intentional vs. non-symbolic. This is a well-established ontological distinction in SUMO and provides strong separation for Fisher-LDA. While Flag doesn't have a true antonym (like good↔evil), the artifact/natural distinction is fundamental and maximizes distributional distance. For AI safety monitoring, distinguishing human-created symbolic systems from natural phenomena is conceptually meaningful.
